page.title: 12THE TOTLEY INDEPENDENT
page.content: {The Totley Independent }is published by the Totley Residents' Association. In the June 1985 issue there is news of the decision to try to revive one of Totley's old events this September,the 'Produce Show',where the emphasis will be on the display of the results of local "gardeners, cooks, knitters, sewers, winemakers and flower arrangers". Professional exhibiters are to be discouraged.In 'The Farming Scene',the delaying effects of the cool,dry Spring on the growth of "plants and trees alike" is discussed.News of the Scouts and their paper collection,the Cheshire Home's new wing,The Totley Good Companions, 'Songs of Praise' at All Saint's Church,{Transport 17's }minibus for taking the elderly to community events,and a local resident's concern about litter feature in this issue.
